questions.question: Since light takes time to travel, the farther out into space we look ...

choices.answer: the further back in time we see
the further into the future we see
we see things that happened just recently

questions.question: What is the most distant thing in space that we can see without a telescope?

choices.answer: the Orion Nebula, a stellar nursery in our Milky Way
the Andromeda galaxy, our closest neighbor
the Virgo cluster, a collection of about 2000 galaxies

questions.question: Besides galaxies beyond the Milky Way, what were Hubble and his colleagues first to discover?

choices.answer: that distant galaxies move farther and farther away from us
that distant galaxies look like the Milky Way
that distant galaxies give off light

questions.question: At the moment of the Big Bang, about 13.8 billion years ago, the universe was ...

choices.answer: hot and dense like the center of a star
hot and dense like the center of Earth
scientists have no idea

questions.question: What is the cosmic microwave background?

choices.answer: a bright white light from the Big Bang
low energy radiowaves from the Big Bang
a loud noise from the Big Bang explosion

questions.question: The Planck satellite was launched in 2009 to measure light in the microwave band. It orbits:

choices.answer: the Moon
Earth
the Sun

questions.question: In Albert Einstein's famous equation E=mc2, what does 'c' represent?

choices.answer: temperature
the speed of light
gravity

questions.question: Normal matter makes up how much of the total mass-energy in the universe?

choices.answer: less than 5 percent
about 25 percent
more than 70 percent

questions.question: Dark matter is invisible, so how do scientists know it exists?

choices.answer: its gravity affects stars and galaxies
it emits light in otherwise dark regions of space
it absorbs light like a black hole

questions.question: How did dark energy get its name?

choices.answer: it's related to dark matter
light cannot escape it
astronomers don't know much about it
